item.title: L-R Graves of Mirza's father, Mirza, Sahibaan
item.dc:creator: zrl214
kh1242
item.excerpt:encoded: Members of Boko Haram and Abubakar Muhammad Shekau, deceased former leader of the group. Image via AFP.

item.dc:creator: kh1242
item.content:encoded: A screengrab taken from a video released on You Tube on April 12, 2012 apparently shows Boko Haram leader Abubakar Shekau (C) sitting flanked by militants. The suspected leader of Nigerian Islamist group Boko Haram appeared in a video posted on YouTube today in which he sends a message to President Goodluck Jonathan and vows to fight on. The 14-minute clip is however mild compared to previous messages from Abubakar Shekau, the alleged leader of the main branch of the group blamed for scores of shootings and bombings, mostly in Nigeria's mainly Muslim north. RESTRICTED TO EDITORIAL USE - MANDATORY CREDIT "AFP PHOTO / YOUTUBE" - NO MARKETING NO ADVERTISING CAMPAIGNS - DISTRIBUTED AS A SERVICE TO CLIENTS (Photo credit should read -/AFP/Getty Images)
item.excerpt:encoded: Abubakar Muhammad Shekau and Boko Haram. Image via AFP.

item.title: 100608-N-7456N-036
item.dc:creator: kh1242
item.content:encoded: GUANTANAMO BAY, Cuba  A detainee reads the Quran in a recreation yard at Joint Task Force Guantanamo, June 8, 2010. Detainees are provided Qurans and other religious items. JTF Guantanamo conducts safe, humane, legal and transparent care and custody of detainees, including those convicted by military commission and those ordered released by a court. The JTF conducts intelligence collection, analysis and dissemination for the protection of detainees and personnel working in JTF Guantanamo facilities and in support of the War on Terror. JTF Guantanamo provides support to the Office of Military Commissions, to law enforcement and to war crimes investigations. The JTF conducts planning for and, on order, responds to Caribbean mass migration operations. (JTF Guantanamo photo by Navy Mass Communication Specialist 3rd Class Joshua Nistas) UNCLASSIFIED  Cleared for public release. For additional information contact JTF Guantanamo PAO 011-5399-3589; DSN 660-3589 www.jtfgtmo.southcom.mil

item.title: 100608-N-7456N-036
item.dc:creator: kh1242
item.content:encoded: GUANTANAMO BAY, Cuba – A detainee reads the Qur’an in a recreation yard at Joint Task Force Guantanamo, June 8, 2010. Detainees are provided Qur’ans and other religious items. JTF Guantanamo conducts safe, humane, legal and transparent care and custody of detainees, including those convicted by military commission and those ordered released by a court. The JTF conducts intelligence collection, analysis and dissemination for the protection of detainees and personnel working in JTF Guantanamo facilities and in support of the War on Terror. JTF Guantanamo provides support to the Office of Military Commissions, to law enforcement and to war crimes investigations. The JTF conducts planning for and, on order, responds to Caribbean mass migration operations. (JTF Guantanamo photo by Navy Mass Communication Specialist 3rd Class Joshua Nistas) UNCLASSIFIED – Cleared for public release. For additional information contact JTF Guantanamo PAO 011-5399-3589; DSN 660-3589 www.jtfgtmo.southcom.mil

item.title: Guantanamo Force Feeding Restraint Chair
item.dc:creator: kh1242
item.content:encoded: Feeding chair and enteral nourishment preparation inside the Joint Medical Group where the detainees receive medical care, Naval Station Guantanamo Bay, Cuba, April 10, 2013. (Photo By Army Sgt. Brian Godette)
item.excerpt:encoded: By Brian Godette [Public domain], via Wikimedia Commons

item.title: Egypt-Politics-Day of Egyptian Presidential Election Result
item.dc:creator: kh1242
item.excerpt:encoded: Cairo, June 24, 2012. The Muslim Brotherhood, celebrate in Tahrir square and in streets near the official victory of their new president. Photo © Stephen Dock/Corbis.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: a:5:{s:5:"width";i:5212;s:6:"height";i:3468;s:4:"file";s:23:"2013/09/42-35091768.jpg";s:5:"sizes";a:6:{s:9:"thumbnail";a:4:{s:4:"file";s:23:"42-35091768-150x150.jpg";s:5:"width";i:150;s:6:"height";i:150;s:9:"mime-type";s:10:"image/jpeg";}s:6:"medium";a:4:{s:4:"file";s:23:"42-35091768-300x200.jpg";s:5:"width";i:300;s:6:"height";i:200;s:9:"mime-type";s:10:"image/jpeg";}s:5:"large";a:4:{s:4:"file";s:24:"42-35091768-1024x681.jpg";s:5:"width";i:1024;s:6:"height";i:681;s:9:"mime-type";s:10:"image/jpeg";}s:14:"post-thumbnail";a:4:{s:4:"file";s:23:"42-35091768-310x150.jpg";s:5:"width";i:310;s:6:"height";i:150;s:9:"mime-type";s:10:"image/jpeg";}s:7:"950x425";a:4:{s:4:"file";s:23:"42-35091768-950x425.jpg";s:5:"width";i:950;s:6:"height";i:425;s:9:"mime-type";s:10:"image/jpeg";}i:950;a:4:{s:4:"file";s:23:"42-35091768-950x632.jpg";s:5:"width";i:950;s:6:"height";i:632;s:9:"mime-type";s:10:"image/jpeg";}}s:10:"image_meta";a:11:{s:8:"aperture";d:9.5;s:6:"credit";s:22:"© Stephen Dock/Corbis";s:6:"camera";s:17:"M9 Digital Camera";s:7:"caption";s:359:"24 Jun 2012, Cairo, Egypt --- After many days, then many hours of wait, the supporters of Mursi, finalist in the Egyptian Presidential Election, leader of the Justice and Freedom Party, member of the Muslim Brotherhood, celebrate in Tahrir square and streets near the official victory of their new president for four years. --- Image by © Stephen Dock/Corbis";s:17:"created_timestamp";i:1340556128;s:9:"copyright";s:32:"© Corbis. All Rights Reserved.";s:12:"focal_length";s:2:"28";s:3:"iso";s:3:"200";s:13:"shutter_speed";s:5:"0.004";s:5:"title";s:59:"Egypt-Politics-Day of Egyptian Presidential Election Result";s:11:"orientation";i:1;}}

item.title: Critics Notebook Colbert
item.dc:creator: kh1242
item.content:encoded: [NEW YORK, NY - APRIL 24: Stephen Colbert and Timothy Cardinal Dolan attend the TIME 100 Gala celebrating TIME'S 100 Most Infuential People In The World at Jazz at Lincoln Center on April 24, 2012 in New York City. (Photo by Kevin Mazur/WireImage for TIME)] *** [] ** TCN OUT **

item.title: 060226-N-2959L-092
item.dc:creator: kh1242
item.content:encoded: 060226-N-2959L-092 Arabian Gulf (February 26, 2006) ñ Lt. Kenneth Medve, Navy Chaplain, reads the blessing of communion during Roman Catholic service in the foc'sle on board USS Ronald Reagan (CVN 76). Reagan is currently deployed as part of a routine rotation of U.S. maritime forces in support of Operations Iraqi Freedom and Enduring Freedom, as well as conducting Maritime Security Operations (MSO) in the region. MSO set the conditions for security and stability in the maritime environment as well as complement the counter-terrorism and security efforts of regional nations. MSO deny international terrorists use of the maritime environment as a venue for attack or to transport personnel, weapons, or other material. Official U.S. Navy photo by Photographer's Mate 3rd Class Dominique M. Lasco (RELEASED)

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: a:5:{s:5:"width";i:2100;s:6:"height";i:1368;s:4:"file";s:29:"2013/10/securedownload-1.jpeg";s:5:"sizes";a:6:{s:9:"thumbnail";a:4:{s:4:"file";s:29:"securedownload-1-150x150.jpeg";s:5:"width";i:150;s:6:"height";i:150;s:9:"mime-type";s:10:"image/jpeg";}s:6:"medium";a:4:{s:4:"file";s:29:"securedownload-1-300x195.jpeg";s:5:"width";i:300;s:6:"height";i:195;s:9:"mime-type";s:10:"image/jpeg";}s:5:"large";a:4:{s:4:"file";s:30:"securedownload-1-1024x667.jpeg";s:5:"width";i:1024;s:6:"height";i:667;s:9:"mime-type";s:10:"image/jpeg";}s:14:"post-thumbnail";a:4:{s:4:"file";s:29:"securedownload-1-310x150.jpeg";s:5:"width";i:310;s:6:"height";i:150;s:9:"mime-type";s:10:"image/jpeg";}s:7:"950x425";a:4:{s:4:"file";s:29:"securedownload-1-950x425.jpeg";s:5:"width";i:950;s:6:"height";i:425;s:9:"mime-type";s:10:"image/jpeg";}i:950;a:4:{s:4:"file";s:29:"securedownload-1-950x619.jpeg";s:5:"width";i:950;s:6:"height";i:619;s:9:"mime-type";s:10:"image/jpeg";}}s:10:"image_meta";a:11:{s:8:"aperture";d:2.79999999999999982236431605997495353221893310546875;s:6:"credit";s:9:"U.S. Navy";s:6:"camera";s:9:"NIKON D1X";s:7:"caption";s:521:"060226-N-2959L-092 Persian Gulf (Feb. 26, 2006) - Navy Chaplain, Lt. Kenneth Medve, reads the blessing of communion during Roman Catholic service in the foc'sle aboard the Nimitz-class aircraft carrier USS Ronald Reagan (CVN 76). Reagan and embarked Carrier Air Wing One Four (CVW-14) are currently deployed on her maiden deployment conducting Maritime Security Operations (MSO) in the region and participating in the global war on terrorism. U.S. Navy photo by Photographer's Mate 3rd Class Dominique M. Lasco (RELEASED)";s:17:"created_timestamp";i:1125763456;s:9:"copyright";s:0:"";s:12:"focal_length";s:2:"45";s:3:"iso";i:0;s:13:"shutter_speed";s:4:"0.02";s:5:"title";s:18:"060226-N-2959L-092";s:11:"orientation";i:1;}}

item.dc:creator: kh1242
item.content:encoded: 085855.MN.0811.Najaf.1.CMC--NAJAF, IRAQ--Father Paul Shaughnessy says a blessing for U.S. Army Sgt. Hector Rivera as he carries out his mission with the troops in Najaf. Five U.S. soldiers were killed in action in Najaf in the past week. Photo/Art: Carolyn Cole / Los Angeles Times

item.title: APTOPIX China Protest
item.dc:creator: kh1242
item.content:encoded: A group of Uighurs protest in front of journalists visiting the area in Urumqi, China, Tuesday, July 7, 2009. The city, where rioting and ethnic clashes killed over one hundred people two days ago, remained extremely tense Tuesday, as security officials and police continued to work to restore order.(AP Photo/Ng Han Guan)
